snippet: Pittsburgh’s general manager was willing to overpay, but not insanely, to put the missing pieces in place for the team’s first playoff run in more than two decades.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column; Pittsburgh Pirates defeat St Louis Cardinals, 5-3, to take two-games-to-one lead in American League division series; Pirates made smart midseason moves, overpaying, but not insanely, to put missing pieces in place for team's first playoff run in more than two decades.
lead_paragraph: Pittsburgh’s general manager was willing to overpay, but not insanely, to put the missing pieces in place for the team’s first playoff run in more than two decades.

headline.main: Pirates, Willing to Be Stupid, Made Smart Midseason Moves
headline.print_headline: Pirates, Willing to Be Stupid, Made Smart Midseason Moves
